explanation: The definition of Confidential Information automatically covers oral information "whether or not marked or otherwise identified as confidential," and contains no requirement that oral disclosures be designated as confidential at the time of disclosure or confirmed in writing within a set period. Therefore, the contract does not meet the rule’s requirement that oral disclosures must be identified as confidential when made and confirmed in writing (e.g., within 30 days) to gain protection.
rule: Require that oral disclosures must be identified as confidential at the time of disclosure and confirmed in writing within a specified period (e.g., 30 days) to be protected.
exampleLanguage: Any oral disclosure of Confidential Information must be identified as confidential at the time of disclosure and confirmed in writing within thirty (30) days to be protected under this Agreement.
